profile_data.summary:
As a philomath (a lover of learning), I enjoy learning and I am fascinated by the evolution of the universe and the inventions made by the humankind. I am most excited by the potential of Artificial Intelligence to transform every walk of life on the Earth and beyond. I am an AI generalist and I am currently exploring the intricacies of LLMs, multimodality and their embeddings in my current role. 

Prior to this, some of my proudest accomplishments include developing patented and core computer vision technologies using deep learning in my previous role. As a graduate researcher, I invented a novel and explainable machine learning framework called Recurrent-Sum-Product-Max networks (RSPMNs) based on deep probabilistic models that could be used for offline reinforcement learning. 

In the future, I would like to leverage my skills in Artificial Intelligence and Problem Solving to work on challenging problems that could have a profound impact on the society. 

Please feel free to contact me about any relevant opportunities or to have interesting conversations.

Programming Skills: Python, C, C++, Java, C, Scala
Software/tools: NumPy, scikit-learn, Pytorch, Pandas, Keras, Git, TensorFlow, R, Spark, Jupyter Notebooks, Weka, AWS, Google cloud, Graphviz, Matplotlib
Systems: Linux/Unix, Windows
profile_data.headline: AI Scientist/Engineer | Early/Founding Engineer | Invented a novel explainable ML algorithm for reinforcement learning

experience.description:
1. Collaborated with CEO, technical advisors, and Head of Product to identify AI and ML-driven product features.
2. Ideated and developed Agentic AI workflows using LLMs to enhance SEO, conversion rate optimization, and readability of Amazon product listings, resulting in increased e-commerce sales.
3. Designed a reinforcement learning-based multi-agent AI system leveraging Microsoft's cutting-edge Autogen framework to improve product listings and demonstrate Agentic AI potential for Andiron products.
4. Developed a novel Multi-LLM Agentic framework for market research and content generation, using CrewAI, Apify, and MongoDB, leading to the acquisition of several new brand clients.
5. Optimized keyword research processes by reducing runtime from 30 minutes and 128GB RAM to an on-demand execution with less than 4GB RAM.
6. Improved code performance by implementing asynchronous I/O functionality, enhancing runtime efficiency.
7. Integrated AI-driven features into product development through collaboration with the product team.
8. Developed time-series forecasting models for product click-through rates using Pandas.
9. Contributed to the analysis and application of the Nixtla TimeGPT model for time-series forecasting.
experience.title: Member of Technical Staff - AI Research and Engineering

experience.locationName: New York, New York, United States
experience.geoLocationName: New York, New York, United States
experience.description:
• As the 4th Full-time employee, Collaborated with the Chief Science Officer, Senior researchers and advisors to advance core machine learning research goals.
• Developed a patented machine learning technology to learn digital 3D representations of whole earth.
• Owned entire ML pipeline of data cleaning and preprocessing, designing ML algorithms, custom losses, evaluation metrics and visualizations and releasing ML models for several product features.
• Developed Geopipe’s neural-network code repository in Tensorflow, Python to generate 3D buildings and identify trees, crosswalks, using aerial imagery and LiDAR inputs.
• Demonstrated efficient collaboration with the team by pair programming, managing interns, enabling new senior researchers to quickly add value by aiding fast and efficient knowledge transfer.
• Improved ML infrastructure by collaborating with Senior engineers to consolidate more than 50 git feature and stale branches to a single development branch which improved development cycles.
• Improved test coverage across ML repository to reduce development issues and have better version control.
• Improved reasoning about data, models and performance by consistently developing better visualization tools using Tensorboard, Matplotlib, NumPy, Pandas.
• Improved data quality by identifying and fixing edge cases and deep issues in the data generation and pre-processing.
• Redesigned slow nested “for loops” into fast vectorized matrix multiplications which showed 120-fold improvement in run-time of data pre-processing scripts which was a bottleneck for development time
• Enabled an annotation to model output feedback loop to improve data annotation.
• Conceptualized and implemented synthetic building generation algorithms in Python, Shapely, GDAL, Seaborn, Matplotlib, Networkx to augment and handle shortages in real-world building data.
• Served as a scrum master to leverage cross-functional skills to eliminate process gaps and prioritize core targets
experience.title: Deep Learning (Computer Vision) Research Engineer

experience.description:
• Invented a novel, first of its kind Machine Learning framework for data-driven, tractable, and explainable sequential-decision making called RSPMNs 
based on deep Probabilistic Graphical Models called Sum-Product networks (SPNs).
• Forged an industry collaboration with my research presentations using Graphviz software for visualization of graphical models of RSPMNs and its 
ease of explainability and interpretability to non-technical audience.
• Developed first publicly available open-source implementation using Python, NumPy, scikit-learn, Pandas, Graphviz for RSPMNs, SPMNs, RSPNs which 
is used as base code by the researchers and professionals all over the world in this field.
• Evaluated that RSPMNs maximize the Expected Utility better than Neural-Network based models on all the 7 new data-driven Reinforcement 
Learning datasets created using OpenAI gym and RDDLSim environments.
• Publicized this research to a wider audience in industry and academia by authoring two conference papers and submitting it to a peer-reviewed
publications with less than 15% acceptance rate.
• Awarded with ROOST scholarship where only 3% of students of a department can get nominated.
• Funded by NSF grant and facilitated NSF funding by helping PI with writing grant proposals and progress report
experience.title: Graduate Research Assistant - Reinforcement Learning

experience.description:
• Collaborated in a team of 11 to maintain 100% availability of IBM-WebSphere Application Servers for web-applications of American Express.
• Analyzed 2+ years of server incidents reported to our team on Service now for identifying repeated daily issues.
• Reduced the daily reported issues in the environment by 8% by spearheading a team of 3 to write space check and automation scripts using shell
scripting to automate fixing repeated issues.
• Presented our finding and results using plots generated by matplotlib to the manager and director of the client team at American Express.
• Received "On the Spot Award" (being an inspirational role model) for going above and beyond to automate and fix repeated server issues.
• Managed workflow using JIRA and Confluence.
• Built applications using JAVA, Struts, Hibernate, Spring.
experience.title: System Engineer

member.occupation: AI Scientist/Engineer | Early/Founding Engineer | Invented a novel explainable ML algorithm for reinforcement learning

projects.description:
• Identified a project idea that would compare Sum-Product Networks I was using in my research with powerful generative neural-networks,
Autoencoders and GANs which would lend me better insight into applicability of my research.
• Used 35.9k, 48X48 pixel images of faces to train and reconstruct faces on test datasets with 0-50% of the pixels removed.
• Implemented GANs and Autoencoders with U-net structure using Keras with TensorFlow backend and used cloud services like AWS and GCP for GPU support.
• Evaluated the models using the closeness (Squared error) in estimated pixels in reconstructed image to pixels from original images.
• Met immediate deadlines by taking up extra responsibility while teammate was ill while appropriately splitting the work later.
projects.title: Face reconstruction using Sum-product networks, Auotencoders and GANs

member.occupation: AI Scientist/Engineer | Early/Founding Engineer | Invented a novel explainable ML algorithm for reinforcement learning

projects.description:
• Implemented Monte-Carlo Tree Search in JAVA to build an AI agent to play the game of GO.
• Achieved a win rate of 88% over a player using random strategy with this implementation.
• Adapted the evaluation strategy by creating a baseline randomized algorithm as the game engine interface had integration issues during the final submission days.
projects.title: Implementation of Monte-Carlo Tree Search in the game of GO

member.occupation: AI Scientist/Engineer | Early/Founding Engineer | Invented a novel explainable ML algorithm for reinforcement learning

projects.description:
• Collaborated with a team of 3 to make PacMan search through a maze for food.
• Devised PacMan AI search agent by implementing depth first search, breadth first search, uniform cost search and A* algorithms in Python.
• Generated AI search agent’s optimal path by engineering various heuristics for the use with A* search algorithm.
• Played key role in planning a strategy to split the project into three independent pieces for agile development process
projects.title: PacMan capture the food

member.occupation: AI Scientist/Engineer | Early/Founding Engineer | Invented a novel explainable ML algorithm for reinforcement learning

projects.description:
• Compared accuracies of Bayes classifier, LDA, SVM, Random forests and neural networks to classify a poker hand given the 5 playing cards drawn from the deck of 52 playing cards from a dataset of 1m data points.
• Implemented each of these models in Python, Spark, R, Scala.
• Produced 98.5% accuracy on the task by designing the best working model using neural networks
projects.title: Poker hand classification

member.occupation: AI Scientist/Engineer | Early/Founding Engineer | Invented a novel explainable ML algorithm for reinforcement learning

projects.description:
• Led a team of 5 to predict the age, sex, relationship of the perpetrator to the victim in a homicide.
• 638k data points collected from homicide reports in the US from 1980-2014.
• Compared Decision trees, Naive Bayes, KNN, Association rule mining and ensemble learning methods in Weka
• Improved our accuracies of classification by 15% by grouping 28 class labels for relationship into fewer classes by investigating various psychology journals and papers to group together various relationships.
• Organized regular short meetings to keep the team on track, guided other team members when they were struck with some problems requiring specific domain knowledge. Drafted a report and presented our results using Weka’s data visualization to an audience of 45 members
projects.title: The Sherlock Project: Profiling the Perpetrator in a Homicide
